name: Lot Status
values: Awaiting Hold Point Release, Awaiting NCR Closure, Awaiting Test Results, Awaiting Verification, Cancelled, Closed-out, Outstanding, Work In Progress

name: Acceptance criteria - What is the lot size?
Acceptance criteria - Has the work area been set out for line and level?
Acceptance criteria - Has the material being excavated been inspected with category agreed upon by Superintendent?
Acceptance criteria - Has the material to be used been approved for use?
Acceptance criteria - Where necessary, have batters been rounded and catch drains constructed to allow for potential surface runoff during the course of excavation?
Acceptance criteria - Has the area been cleared and grubbed in accordance with ITP-002?

Acceptance criteria - Have external factors such as weather and construction activities been considered to ensure excavations will be protected from water, erosion, deterioration and excessive drying or wetting?
Acceptance criteria - Has the cut surface been trimmed to an even surface free from lose material?
• Have surface levels been checked to avoid over excavation?
Acceptance criteria - Has mix design been completed and submitted?
• Have Lime spreading rates been submitted to RJE?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Has trial site been established and confirmed?
Acceptance criteria - Has the prepared subgrade been lime stabilised as per the IFC design?
Acceptance criteria - Compaction Scale: 3 tests per lot. See RJE approved lots:

• Has the stabilised subgrade been adequately compacted achieving 98% SMDD / 95% MMDD (in-situ materials or subgrade preparation), or 75% density index for the in-situ and fill materials. Using a nuclear density gauge.
• Is the subgrade material with 2% of the optimum moisture content.
• Is the subgrade within +/- 20mm of design surface?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Does the layer withstand test rolling without visible deformation or springing?
Identification of soft wet or unstable material
Acceptance criteria - What quantity of soft, wet or unstable material is present?
Acceptance criteria - Has rectification process been submitted to RJE for review?
• What was the rectification process used?
Acceptance criteria - Does the stripped surface to be filled withstand test rolling without visible deformation or springing?
Identification of soft wet or unstable material
Acceptance criteria - What quantity of soft, wet or unstable material is present?
Acceptance criteria - What rectification process is to be undertaken?
Acceptance criteria - Has adequate water been added to the stripped surface to ensure adhesion to the next layer?
Acceptance criteria - Has fill been placed in maximum 300mm and minimum 100mm compacted layer thickness?
Acceptance criteria - Has the material maintained at optimum moisture content (within 2% of optimum moisture), with additional water being added if required during compaction?
Acceptance criteria - Compaction Scale: 3 tests per lot. See RJE approved lots:

• Has the subgrade been adequately compacted achieving 98% SMDD / 95% MMDD (in-situ materials or subgrade preparation), or 75% density index for the in-situ and fill materials. Using a nuclear density gauge.
• Is the subgrade within +/- 20mm of design surface.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Does the layer withstand test rolling without visible deformation or springing?
• If ‘yes’ please proceed to fill construction
Identification of soft wet or unstable material
Acceptance criteria - What quantity of soft, wet or unstable material is present?
Acceptance criteria - Has rectification process been submitted to RJE for Review?
• What was the rectification process used?
Acceptance criteria - Has the pavement been constructed at the correct width and alignment as detailed in the construction drawings?
Acceptance criteria - Has the prepared subgrade been surveyed in accordance with and verifying specified requirements?
• Is the subgrade within +/- 20mm of design surface.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
